summary: Request to create a NestJS integration/transport for the TypeScript SDK to enable decorator-based workflow and activity definitions following NestJS conventions. The requester explored a proof-of-concept and established design principles for supporting both monolithic and microservice architectures while avoiding non-deterministic code patterns.
userImpact: NestJS developers cannot use familiar decorator-based patterns with Temporal SDK, requiring custom workarounds for dependency injection in activities.
rootCause: The TypeScript SDK uses a functional paradigm rather than OOP/decorator-based approach that NestJS developers expect, limiting integration with NestJS's module system.
proposedFix: Create a NestJS module that supports @Workflow() and @InjectActivities() decorators, with workflowsPath supporting both default export functions and object exports. Support for dependency injection through NestJS's container.
workaround: Community members have built internal packages using higher-order functions for dependency injection, or used third-party packages like nestjs-temporal.
keyQuote: The main problem for me I am not able to inject other services into my activities, for example if I have an activity interacts with the outside world so it needs the httpService
